weather_report:
As morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the city is cloaked in the gentle embrace of a marine layer, a soft fog swirling around the urban landscape. With only a hint of drizzle expected before noon, the day feels crisp yet oddly inviting, atypically bright for the season as the sun prepares to break through the cloud cover. The high will flirt with 64 degrees, the west-southwest winds whispering through the streets, offering a cool caress that complements the remnants of spring. 

As the evening approaches, the clouds will thickly settle back in, with more drizzle anticipated, creating an atmosphere perfect for introspection or tranquility. It’s the kind of day best suited for a leisurely afternoon spent wandering the lesser-known streets of the city, perhaps stopping at a cozy café for a warm drink, or seeking out quaint bookshops that invite you to lose track of time. Dressing in layers will grant you comfort—perhaps a light sweater over a tee, paired with comfortable shoes, readying yourself for a stroll along the Hidden Garden Steps or the scenic trails of Land’s End. Amidst the fog and the poignant nostalgia of a San Francisco afternoon, it’s essential to embrace the beauty of this weather, allowing the stillness to inspire a reflective pause in your day.
